intro: Cracca vulgaris, commonly known as common cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and clusters of pink or red flowers. The plant produces small, heart-shaped leaves and has a fibrous root system. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed areas. Cracca vulgaris is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
